Creative Connection.knownFor: “ a most pleasant "find" ” Reviewed June 24, 2014 We decided to take a back road parallel to Hiway 101 and found this charming little shop. It is chocked full of buttons, ribbons, sewing notions, quilting supplies, antiques and collectibles, etc. The shop owner is a lovely lady; full of ideas and information. I will return with my friends in the near future. Helpful? Thank Old New Orleans Boy Report Ginathemayor Level Contributor 13 reviews 5 attraction reviews “ A lot of everything in one little store. ” Reviewed September 12, 2013 Defiantly a lot of choices. Very much a variety of collectables and fun items throughout the store. locally owned and operated for many years in this quaint little town. Try to stop by when you see the open sign. The Tefft family members Will take good care of you. Helpful? Thank Ginathemayor Report

reviewComments: Check internet for deals, nice peaceful location with ample parking, food and drinks are pricey , food orders can be slow in coming
One of the first local 18 to 27 hole course. Try to find a deal as it's expensive. The courses are set into 3 9 hole sections. Going 9 holes is not financially practical.
Well maintained golf course down the street from Monarch Dunes CC. Not particularly challenging. Quiet and out of the way so it doesn't get a ton of play.

Great golfing, super clubhouse and all of the amenities. Food is delicious. Make sure to make golf reservations since this is a popular golf course
Beautifully cut from a very old Eucalyptus woodland with an interesting history. Some nice up and down wholes and a Scottish style par3 challenge course as well.
Monarch Dunes is a very nice links style course. It is playable by all skill levels, but provides plenty of challenge for better players.
